thread.title: Giant Gray Blobby Thing Has Become A Huge Meme In Russia For Some Reason
thread.title_full: This Giant Gray Blobby Thing Has Become A Huge Meme In Russia For Some Reason - BuzzFeed News

author: Rachael Krishna, Victor Stepanov
title: Giant Gray Blobby Thing Has Become A Huge Meme In Russia For Some Reason
text:
View this image ›
pikabu.ru ID: 10549840 2. The picture of the sculpture subsequently spread across Russian social media, were it became a huge meme. Facebook Post . facebook.com “Hey lady, why are you cutting in line without even asking?”
ID: 10549899 3. The sculpture was given the name “Zhdun,” which roughly means “the one who waits.” Facebook Post . facebook.com “I clicked on something and everyhing disappeared”
ID: 10549909 4. Soon, Zhdun was being photoshopped in with other famous memes, like Graham - the disgusting car crash meme . Facebook Post . facebook.com ID: 10549915 5. He’s found his way into famous art. Facebook Post . facebook.com ID: 10549956 6. Early this month, Zhdun was given his own VK page, which quickly gained over 80,000 followers. View this image ›
vk.com ID: 10549989 7. People then started memeing like crazy. View this image ›
VK ID: 10550050 View this image ›
vk.com “Plans for Valentine’s Day? As usual.”
ID: 10550116 View this image ›
VK ID: 10550133 10. Of course there was a Trump one. View this image ›
vk.com ID: 10550208 11. Russians have even been making visits to the University of Leiden to see Zhdun up close. Loading View on Instagram
instagram.com ID: 10550139 Loading View on Instagram
Instagram: @ulich86 ID: 10550161 13. Margriet van Breevoort, who now calls herself the “mother of the Zhdun,” told BuzzFeed News that she found out her sculpture had become a meme after she got a lot of Russian followers on Instagram. View this image ›
vk.com ID: 10550147 14. She said she loves the reaction, especially when Zhdun is photoshopped into paintings, and says that she might bring the sculpture to Russia in the future. View this image ›
VK ID: 10550150 15. “I am planning on making a new Zhdun companion and maybe a female version for an exhibition in May in Amsterdam,” she said. “After that, it might go to Russia to be exhibited or auctioned.” View this image ›
vk.com ID: 10550148 16. All of Russian internet, waiting for the Zhdun exhibition. View this image ›
vk.com ID: 10550239 Check out more articles on BuzzFeed.com!
Rachael Krishna is a reporter for BuzzFeed News and is based in London. Contact Rachael Krishna at rachael.krishna@buzzfeed.com . Got a confidential tip? Submit it here .
